text:
Heading through the Boiler District, you approach the rundown tavern of the Crooked Bone, hoping Hail may be able to answer a question regarding your current quest. You take all the necessary precautions to avoid disrupting her and patiently wait outside.

After a ferw minutes, she appears beside you. "Well, look at that! Bright-eyed adventurers showing up on my doorstep, dearching for fame and fortune. It just so happens that I am running out of materials for my experiments."

She hands you a crumpled list while continuing to talk. "If you eould be so kind as to grab some of this while you're out, it may bring you fame or possible fortune. Who's to say, really?" She then disappears before you can even speak.

optionA.choice: Retrieve some herbs and mushrooms on a quick trip outside the city.

outcomes.text: In short order, you forage enough to meet Hail's needs and return. She excitedly gathers it from you and then disappears. You wait for some time... She reappears with a look of bewilderment. "You are still here? Very well, maybe this will qualify as a fortune." A bag of gold appears at your feet, and she shoos you away as you pick it up. You leave the tavern, your original question now out of mind.

optionB.choice: Collect some monster entrails during your next quest.

outcomes.instruction: Place this card in any one character's play area: During scenario, if you kill 5 or more monsters, read below. Otherwise: {Remove2}.
outcomes.text: It takes some effort to gather all the entrails Hail needs. She gratefully collects them but stops in her tracks. "I'm forgetting something. What was it? Oh yes, here." She waves a hand and disappears. You feel strange but good. So much for your question though.
effects: You gain one {PlusOneEnhancement} to any level 1 or X card.

text:
The countless tales told of the Diviner Cassandra weigh heavily on your mind. All the strange, new places she's visited seem to taunt you. Being stuck carrying out plain old mercenary work is somehow lacking. A wanderlust is calling you. Traveling to far away locales is always more exciting and daring.

Maybe it's time to leave Gloomhaven, to sate your thirst for exploration away from the mundane goings-on of the city. Or maybe it's only a temporary melancholy, one you can wash away with a long night of revelry and celebration of good times past.

outcomes.text: You decide your time in Gloomhavem must soon come to an end. There have been many fine adventures, and the city has grown more than you expected, but your work is just about finished. There are other places to see in the world. You've hear rumors of a town to the north in need of mercenaries, so that will be your destination of travel.

optionB.choice: Indulge yourself with gambling and drinks at the first available bar.

outcomes.text:
The trip to the bar was a wonderful idea. One drink led to another, and all in all, it was a great time. Although your intoxication conflicted with your gambling, you are left with only fond memories of the night.

Still, there is some melancholy in your mind the next morning. Maybe there was a bit of truth to your musings. Only time will tell.

text:
The hum of activity feels both familiar and welcome as you step inside the Sleeping Lion. It has been a while since you last came here, and the signs of your battle with the demons have been mostly cleaned up.

You take your seat and start to raise your hand to order a rounf of drinks, but then you see a wanted pister for unknown thieves of the bar owner's stringbox, calling for any information regarding the culprits. A sinking feeling settles in your stomach as you realize that the small chest you had found during the battle may not have been ownerless after all.

optionA.choice: Return the gold you had taken for "safekeeping" (requires 30 collective gold)

outcomes.text:
You approach the proprietor of the inn and explain that in the fight, you had been concerned about thieves taking advantage of the chaos to rob him, and you are here to give back his money.

He sighs in relief."Thank you for returning my belongings! I'm glad you weren't stealing it for your own purposes. Have a free meal!"

optionB.choice: Shrug it off. Surely, no one can connect you to the crime.

outcomes.text: After ordering drinks and food and settling in for the evening, you see the proprietor of the inn approach you. He goes on and on about his missing strongbox and implores you over and over that if you know anyhting, please tell him. It's quite exhausting. At the end of the night, you tip him exorbitantly, hoping it will make hime feel better, but perhaps it does lay bare your own guilt.

text:
I has been some time since your encounter with the vile cultists in the Dekhem Gardens, so you decide to visit the area to see how things are recovering.

When you arrive, you are surprised to find members of the Great Oak asking passersby for donation, so you walk up to a Keeper of the Oak and ask him what's happened.

"One of our number was carrying as stringbox the recent attach occured and we cannot locate it. I hope whoever found it put it to good use, but we are certainly missing the funds now. Would you be willing to lend a hand?" Remembering what happened to the cache, your guilty conscience doesn't allow you to say no.

optionA.choice: Offer a donation to the sanctuary (requires 15 collective gold).

outcomes.text:
You nod to the keeper, and feeling badly for his loss, you hand him whatever you can spare. While the gold isn't quote the amount you had taken, you are able to leave feeling better about yourself. But just a bit.

He is grateful and offers a small prayer to you."May kindness guide your ways."

You pause, not having much in the way of money right now, but decide to help with the collection effort. You spend hours asking the citizens of Gloomhaven to contribute. In the end, you are able to give a hefty sum to the keeper. He blesses you and thanks you for your support. You of course, were the reason for the problem, but this hopefully made up for it.

text:
Ever since the battle on the docks, you have been carrying the Orchid scrolls arround with you, unsure what to do with them. While the Orchid you met told you to rescue these items, she did not come to retrieve them after the fight, nor have you been able to locate her since.

Then one night wile out drinking, you are approached by a different orchid woman, this one immaculately dressed. "Do you have the records?" Hesitating, you hand the scrolls to her. "I am very grateful to get these back and for you bravery in having recovered them so valiantly. The High Council would like to show its gratitude. Would you welcome a feast in your honor or prefer the anonimity of a gift?"

outcomes.text: In the evening, you are escorted to an opulent manor in the upper Coin District. Pretty sure that you will never be in a place like this again, you try to soak up as much as you can. You meet a constant stream of Orchid dignitaries who blur together until you cannot hope to remember their names. When the food comes, it is exotic and delicious. Spices that you didn't know existed delight your palate and heighten your senses. The next morning, you feel invigorated for the journey.
effects: Start scenario with BLESS {Bless} and STRENGTHEN {Strengthen}.

outcomes.text: You are pretty sure that being a guest of honor at a feast will bring unwanted attention, so you opt for the gift instead. The orchid women hands you a wrapped bundle. Inside, you find a double-edged dagger unlike anything you have ever seen before — subtle curves and an expert balance. In awe, you thank her profusely. She responds, "In earlier times, it was the weapon of choice for a notorious thief. Put it to better use.

text:
Your thoughts turn to the mysterious Orchid girl and the caravan you protected in your trip to the past. She said events could not be changed and it was dangerous to try, but were your attempts to save them really for naught? These thoughts race through your head as you return to your room for the evening and find a not affixed to your door:

"I have waited a long time to say thank you, but I hope this finds you well. The caravan was destined to be lost, but because of you, Moonshard was not, and her company out here in the wilderness all these years has been a true blessing. Perhaps one day we will meet again, but for your own sake, I hope not.

— Terra"

optionA.choice: Ask arround and try to track down whoever put the note on your door.

outcomes.text: You frantically look around for someone who may have seen who placed the note. Surely, someone saw something important, but in all your efforts, no one you find remembers anyhting. Desperate, you pull out the note to hopefully jog someone's memory, but as you do, it begins to crumble into dust, leaving behind no trace of the words written upon it. Dejected, you finally give up.

optionB.choice: Accept the note for what it is, and be satisfied you made a positive difference.

outcomes.text: There is no reason to investigate. You have all the information you need. The caravan was still destroyed, and Terra has been living in the wilderness ever since, unknown to anyone and workung toward some mysterious goal. It is crazy just thinking about it, so you decide not to. You trustshe is in the right place and are happy to have helped.

text:
This strange cipher full of odd Aesther characters has been bothering you to no end. What does it mean? Surely, you could spend some time asking around town to see if anyone had any clues or advice.

One possibility would be to ask Dominic Scrim for his expertise. In his exhaustive research of the past, he might have stumbled upon notes or books concerning this strange language.

Another possiblity might be to go to the Void and inquire with the Vigil at the excavation site. It would be a harder conversation, but they must have uncovered something useful in their work.

outcomes.text: You set out to the Town Records building with the hopes that Dominic is available today.
